description._content: Hine, Lewis Wickes,, 1874-1940,, photographer. Amos is 6 and Horace 4 years old. Their father, John Neal is a renter and raises tobacco. He said (and the owner of the land confirmed it) that both these boys work day after day from "sun-up to sun-down" worming and suckering, and that they are as steady as a grown-up. Location: Warren County--Albaton, Kentucky 1916 August 19. 1 photographic print. Notes: Title from NCLC caption card. In album: Agriculture. Hine no. 4455. "Div. 5" recorded on caption card as part of the geographic location; probably refers to a school district. Subjects: Boys. Agricultural laborers. Tobacco industry. United States--Kentucky--Warren County--Albaton. Format: Photographic prints. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Photographs from the records of the National Child Labor Committee (U.S.) 2004667950 General information about the Lewis Hine child labor photos is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.nclc Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/nclc.00501 Call Number: LOT 7475, v. 2, no. 4455
